Race.SpecificTitle: Justice(s) of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace District 5
Constable(s) -- Justice of the Peace District 3
Constable(s) -- Justice of the Peace District 5
Village of Heflin Prop.#1 -- Prop.#1 - 6% Package Alcohol - Mayor&BOA
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1

Summary:  Authority to sell beverages of alcoholic content containing not more than six percent alcohol by volume by package only and not for consumption on the premises in the Village of Heflin.
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of alcoholic content containing not more than six percent alcohol by volume be permitted by package only and not for consumption on the premises in the Village of Heflin?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Heflin Prop.#2 -- Prop.#2 - 6% Consumption Alcohol -Mayor&BOA
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2

Summary:  Authority to sell beverages of alcoholic content containing not more than six percent alcohol by volume for consumption on the premises in the Village of Heflin.
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of alcoholic content containing not more than six percent alcohol by volume for consumption on the premises be permitted in the Village of Heflin?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Heflin Prop.#3 -- Prop.#3 - 1/2% Consumption Alcohol -Mayor&BOA
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 3

Summary:  Authority to sell beverages of alcoholic content containing one-half of one percent alcohol by volume and above for consumption on the premises in the Village of Heflin.
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverage alcohol containing one-half of one percent alcohol by volume and above for consumption on the premises be permitted in the Village of Heflin?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Heflin Prop.#4 -- Prop.#4 - 1/2% Package Alcohol -Mayor&BOA
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 4

Summary:  Authority to sell beverages of alcoholic content containing one-half of one percent alcohol by volume and above by package only and not for consumption on the premises in the Village of Heflin.
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of alcoholic content containing one-half of one percent alcohol by volume and above by the package only and not for consumption on the premises be permitted in the Village of Heflin?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Heflin Prop.#5 -- Prop.#5 - Restaurant - Mayor&BOA
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 5

Summary:  Authority to sell beverages of high and low alcoholic content permitted only on the premises of restaurant establishments which have been issued an "R" permit as defined by law in the Village of Heflin.
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of high and low alcoholic content be permitted only on the premises of restaurant establishments which have been issued an "R" permit as defined by law in the Village of Heflin?

Race.SpecificTitle: Dubberly FPD No. 4 -- 10 Mill - BOC - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Dubberly Fire Protection District No. 4 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 10 mill property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment of Dubberly Fire Protection District No. 4, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, and all purposes incidental thereto.
Race.FullText: Shall Dubberly Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of Webster, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an ad valorem tax of ten (10) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $86,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment of the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, and all purposes incidental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cullen FPD No. 6 -- 8.44 Mill - BOC - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Cullen Fire Protection District No. 6 Proposition
(Millage Renewal) 

Summary:  10-year 8.44-mill property tax renewal of Cullen Fire Protection District No.6 for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall Cullen Fire Protection District No. 6 of the Parish of Webster, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy an ad valorem tax of eight and forty-four hundredths (8.44) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018 (an estimated $143,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Cotton Valley FPD No. 8 -- 12 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Cotton Valley Fire Protection District No. 8 Proposition 
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 12 mills property tax continuation for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment for Cotton Valley Fire Protection District No. 8, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall Cotton Valley Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of Webster, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an ad valorem tax of twelve (12) mills on all of the property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $150,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in the District, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?
